skills.name: HTML
skills.description: HTML is short for HyperText Markup Language. HTML is used to create electronic documents (called pages) that are displayed on the World Wide Web.

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: it is used to style web pages.

skills.name: JAVASCRIPT
skills.description: Stands for hypertext markup language. JavaScript is a cross-platform, object-oriented scripting language. It is a small and lightweight language. Inside a host environment (for example, a web browser), JavaScript can be connected to the objects of its environment to provide programmatic control over them.JavaScript contains a standard library of objects, such as Array, Date, and Math, and a core set of language elements such as operators, control structures, and statements.

skills.name: AJAX
skills.description: AJAX is a developer's dream, because you can Update a web page without reloading a web page.

skills.name: JQUERY
skills.description: JQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers. With a combination of versatility and extensibility, jQuery has changed the way that millions of people write JavaScript.
